name: Zitgist Browser Linker
author: Zitgist

sections.description:
This plug-in shows blog readers existing related data for a given URL and, in some case, to enable them to perform actions based on this data.

More explanations and examples are available on this article: “Blogs, WordPress, Zitgist and the Semantic Web
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

e.g.

  1. Upload the folderzitgist_browser_linker to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress

Then you are done. All links within your blog posts and comments will have a rightside icon displayed from where your blog readers will be able to find related resources for each of your links.
sections.faq:
It seems pretty complex, no?

The plugin is in fact really simple at the user end-point. In fact, it only gives “additional”, “related” information about a URL you linked to from your blog post. Check this blog post for more information: Blogs, WordPress, Zitgist and the Semantic Web

short_description: Links all URIs from a blog posts and comments to its related Semantic Web resources.
